ribbonMessages: VIA v0.1 is mocked in this preview.
Washington is learning how guests explore before identity exists.
Investigate a session to see prototype insights.

wash-101.title: Welcome to Washington OnDemand
wash-101.summary: Most guests complete this short product tour and then try at least one more session.

wash-102.title: VIA v0.1: Simulated Insights
wash-102.summary: Viewers tend to lean in when VIA is introduced as a visible agent instead of a hidden recommender.

wash-103.title: Guest Preview Controls
wash-103.summary: Short walkthrough sessions reset anxiety around commitment; most viewers stay within the preview instead of bouncing.

wash-104.title: OnDemand Rails Overview
wash-104.summary: Rails help guests understand Washington as an OS, not a single feed. People rarely scroll beyond three rails in v0.1.

wash-105.title: Washington as a Consumption OS
wash-105.summary: Longer concept sessions are often skimmed; a smaller cohort watches them end-to-end and becomes the core power-user base.

wash-106.title: Identity Graph & VIA
wash-106.summary: Identity graph content drives repeat visits from the same device; even in guest mode, people return to continue the idea.

default.title: Prototype VIA insights
default.summary: In Product One, VIA is simulated. In future versions, this panel will surface live insights tied to your real viewing behavior.
